definition: Kim Jong-il (1942-2011), Dear Leader of North Korea 1982-2011
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: It was the first-ever direct communication from Bush to Kim.
sentences.chinese: 這是布什和金正日之間的第一次直接溝通。

sentences.english: Under Mr. Kim's military-oriented rule, the Workers' Party has withered.
sentences.chinese: 根據金正日的軍事爲本規則，工人黨已經枯死。

sentences.english: Could Kim Jong Il's regime really be brought undone by K-pop and South Korean soap operas?
sentences.chinese: 金正日政權真的有可能被韓國音樂和肥皂劇推翻嗎？

sentences.english: The official news agency saying the 66-year-old provided field guidance.
sentences.chinese: 官方新聞社表示66歲的金正日在現場指導工作。

sentences.english: Mr Kim is an ace non-smiler.
sentences.chinese: 金正日是出了名的“不會笑”。

sentences.english: Why did Kim Jong Il never launch China-style economic reforms?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼金正日從不啓動中國式經濟改革？

sentences.english: Kim is rumored to have visited solar power and electronics companies in Jiangsu province, where Yangzhou is located.
sentences.chinese: 傳聞金正日考察了江蘇揚州的太陽能和電子製造公司。

sentences.english: Neither Russia nor China is happy to see Mr Kim flaunt his bombs.
sentences.chinese: 看見金正日炫耀其核爆試驗，中俄都不會高興。

sentences.english: Kim Jong-il proofread the script over one hundred and fifty times.
sentences.chinese: 金正日同志一百五十多次親臨劇團指導改編。

sentences.english: The Chinese news reports about the visit did not mention the son, however.
sentences.chinese: 不過中國有關金正日訪華的新聞報道並未提及金正雲。

sentences.english: Last year, Kim vanished again - but this time because he was ill.
sentences.chinese: 去年金正日再次消失，但是這次是因爲他病倒了。

sentences.english: Tightening the screws too far risks goading Mr Kim to strike back.
sentences.chinese: 施壓過大的危險在於可能驅使金正日反擊。

sentences.english: Kim Jong-Il conducted his own purges of the military to avoid a coup," Natsios said.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止政變，金正日親自對軍方進行了清洗。

sentences.english: This is the fourth time this year the Korean media reported that Kim Jong Il inspected Huichon station.
sentences.chinese: 這是朝鮮媒體今年第四次報道金正日視察熙川水電站。

sentences.english: Kim Jong Il has anointed his twenty-six-year-old son Kim Jong-un as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 金正日指定二十六歲的兒子金正恩爲繼承人。

sentences.english: Bosworth said he did not meet with North Korean leader Kim Jong Il.
sentences.chinese: 博斯沃思說，他沒有和北韓領導人金正日見面。

definition: Kim Il Sung (1912-1994) Great Leader of North Korea
Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the ruling party of North Korea
Kim Jong-un (c. 1983-), third son of Kim Jong-il 金正日[Jin1 Zheng4 ri4], supreme leader of North Korea from 2011
Park Chung-Hee (1917-1979), South Korean military man and dictator, president 1963-1979, influential in developing Korean industry, murdered by his bodyguard
Jang Song-taek (1946-2013), brother-in-law of Kim Jong-il 金正日[Jin1 Zheng4 ri4], uncle and regent of Kim Jong-un 金正恩[Jin1 Zheng4 en1]
Syngman Rhee (1875-1965), US trained Korean politician and dictator, president of Republic of Korea 1948-1960
Kim Dae-jung (1926-2009), South Korea politician, president 1998-2003, Nobel peace prize laureate 2000
Hwang Jang-yop (1923-2010), North Korean politician known for defecting to South Korea
Chun Doo Hwan (1931-), South Korean politician, president 1980-1988
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Rodong Sinmun (Workers' news), the official newspaper of the North Korean WPK's Central Committee
Roh Moo-hyun (1946-2009), South Korean lawyer and politician, president 2003-2008
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
Kim Young-sam (1927-), South Korean politician, president 1993-1998
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Roh Tae-woo (1932-), South Korean politician, president 1988-1993
